title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. Amendment to the Higher Education Act of 1965 increases Federal Pell Grants for the academic year 2007-2008. The maximum grant amount is raised to $5,100, with adjustments based on expected family contribution. Additionally, the term "400" is replaced with "500" in certain sections. Additional funds are authorized and appropriated for implementation. In paragraph (5), the term "400" is changed to "500". Additional funds of $4,331,000,000 are appropriated to increase the Federal Pell Grant by $1,050 for the academic year 2007-2008. The Federal Pell Grant amount for fiscal year 2007 is increased by $1,050 for award year 2007-2008, effective July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased limitation on maximum deduction for interest on education loans to $3,750 and raised phaseout limits to $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers) for taxable years after 2007. The section specifies that for taxable years after 2007, the deduction for interest on education loans is increased to $3,750 with phaseout limits raised to $75,000 ($150,000 for joint filers). The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. The Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 eliminates the 60-month limit and increases the income limitation on student loan interest deduction. This change applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is after December 31, 2006. Repeal of sunset provision for certain tax relief act sections. Repeal of sunset provision for modifications to education individual retirement accounts under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001. Applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. Repeal of sunset provision for extension of exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance under the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001.
